intro: Ochyrella pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered ochyrella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Ochyrella pauciflora is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns.
